intro: Ischnosiphon lasiocoleus var. bolivioides, commonly known as the Bolivian hairroot, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and often hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes. Its leaves are usually covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators.
